description.narrative:
CISU's Civil Society Fund: Contribute to strengthening resilient and independent civil society in the Global South, which has experienced shrinking civic space as a consequence of disproportionate COVID-19 measures. Engagements are based on equal partnerships between civil society organisations with roots in Denmark and developing countries. CISU is an association of more than 270 popular Danish organizations, all of which are engaged in development work.
CISU Covid-19 2020-2023: The purpose is to strengthen resilient and independent civil societies in the Global South, which has experienced a shrinking civic space, violations on human rights, rights at work, as well as disproportionate restrictions as an effect of the COVID-19 pandemic.
CISU Engagement Fund: Contribute to engaging people in development cooperation in the widest sense possible by creating a framework of opportunities for action and joint solutions towards a world with social justice and responsible climate and environmental conduct, including contribute to increasing knowledge and understanding of conditions in developing countries and UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). This may take the shape of local, national or international initiatives.
More here: https://www.cisu.dk/om-cisu/om-cisu-civilsamfund-i-udvikling
The purpose is to build strong resilient and independent civil societies in the Global South.
